hypothesis_content.title: Post-News Volatility Compression Reversal
hypothesis_content.statement: Following a major crypto exchange news event (e.g., liquidity announcement, regulatory headline), a period of high volatility and indecision (as measured by a 1-hour ATR spike >3% of price and narrowing Bollinger Bands) will resolve with a directional move in the opposite direction of the initial 15-minute knee-jerk reaction, providing a high-probability entry.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Major news creates a liquidity vacuum and emotional overreaction. Professional traders fade the initial retail-driven move, leading to a compression phase. The breakout from this compression often reverses the initial spike as the 'true' market consensus forms, catching late retail momentum traders.
entry_conditions: Major crypto headline (Crypto.com, Coinbase, Binance, SEC) triggers >1.5% price move within 15 minutes.
Subsequent 2-hour consolidation: 1-hour ATR remains elevated (>3% of price) but 20-period Bollinger Band width contracts by >15%.
Entry on break of the high/low of the 2-hour consolidation range, in the direction OPPOSITE the initial 15-minute news spike.

exit_conditions.take_profit: 1.5x the width of the 2-hour consolidation range.
exit_conditions.time_exit: 6 hours after entry if TP/SL not hit.

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Initial news spike continues unabated without meaningful compression (>2 hours of sustained trend), or the breakout from compression continues in the same direction as the initial spike >60% of the time.
